Author: trev5514
Content: Inference was the target yes. You can do GEMM, CNN, and some other common ops with a systolic array. If you do the right numerical representation (fixed/float) you can do training by just doing a second multiplication pass for the gradients/backprop - at least that was my understanding, I've never done it as inference has been my priority.

Author: trev5514
Content: That's cool! I'd love to see a comparison. I looked into an xorshift but went with the systolic array instead. I'm curious to see the potential power/area differences you can get in performance!

Author: lromor_
Content: I see, so you have a lot of synchronous parts. Is your target representation float/fixed point?

Author: trev5514
Content: The entire array is synchronous. I went with ternary weights, 8-bit activations to fit on chip. FP multipliers are huge, so I stuck with int space.
